stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: I start meals with a protein source
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that they often incorporate meat and that they start meals with a protein source, implying meat is chosen due to this habit.

stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: Meat is my go-to protein
justification: The respondent directly says meat is their go-to protein and that they often incorporate meat in meals.

stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: People close to me often eat meat
justification: The respondent notes both their own and close contacts' frequent meat eating, suggesting a supportive environment.

stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: Meat is an efficient protein source
justification: The respondent states they often eat meat and views it as an efficient protein source, supporting their habit.

stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: Other protein sources lack sufficient iron
justification: The difficulty in getting iron from non-meat sources supports the frequent incorporation of meat.

stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: Other protein sources have too much fat and carbs
justification: The respondent reports high fat and carbs in other proteins as a difficulty, supporting meat consumption.

stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: I want to get enough protein
justification: The respondent starts meals with protein and wants sufficient protein, supporting frequent meat consumption.

stance_1: I often incorporate meat in my meals
stance_2: I want to get enough iron
justification: Desire for enough iron supports eating meat, as non-meat proteins were found lacking.

stance_2: I want to get enough protein

stance_2: Other protein sources lack sufficient iron

stance_1: Meat is my go-to protein

stance_1: Meat is an efficient protein source

stance_1: Meat is an efficient protein source
